intro: Visnaga meoides, commonly known as the lesser visnaga, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers and has finely divided, feathery leaves. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. Visnaga meoides is also known for its medicinal properties, historically used in traditional remedies.
